configuration_schema.description: The configuration information processing of RIP module.

public-instance.description: The configuration of RIP public instance.

max-paths.description: Maximum number of parallel routes RIP can support.

validate-update-source.description: Perform sanity checks against source address of routing updates.

flash-update-threshold.description: Specify flash update threshold in second.

networks.description: The configuration of RIP networks in public instance.

network.description: Enable routing on an IP network.

neighbors.description: The configuration of RIP neighbors in public instance.

redistributes.description: Redistribute information from another routing protocol.

with-originate-metric.description: Use original metric of redistributed route.

redistribute-others.description: Redistribute information from another routing protocol.

redistribute-other.description: Redistribute information from another routing protocol.

for-insts.description: Apply offset lists to RIP instance.

for-inst.description: Apply offset lists to RIP instance.

in-or-out.description: Specify the direction of offset list.

acl-name.description: Access list of networks to apply offset list(1-31 characters).

for-ifs.description: Apply offset lists to RIP interface.

for-if.description: Apply offset lists to RIP interface.

in-or-out.description: Specify the direction of offset list.

acl-name.description: Access list of networks to apply offset (1-31 characters).

if-mode.description: The mode of the interface,include active(only send),passive(only recieve) and normal.

only-send-subnet.description: Only send subnet information about the interface.

originate-default-route.description: Originate default route on specified interface.

notify-default-route.description: Enable an interface to notify default route.

originate-default-rpl.description: Use route-policy when originate default route.

neighbor-restrict.description: Enable the interface restrict mode of communicate with neighbors.

Set the authentication key in clear text.

key-clear.description: Set the authentication key in clear text.

auth-key-encrypted.description: Set the authentication key in encrypted text.

key-encrypted.description: Set the authentication key in encrypted text.

vrf-instances.description: The configuration of RIP VRF instances.

vrf-instance.description: The configuration of RIP VRF instance.

max-paths.description: Maximum number of parallel routes RIP can support.

validate-update-source.description: Perform sanity checks against source address of routing updates.

vrf-networks.description: The configuration of RIP networks in VRF instance.

vrf-network.description: Enable routing on an IP network.

vrf-neighbors.description: The configuration of RIP neighbors in VRF instance.

vrf-redistributes.description: Redistribute information from another routing protocol in VRF instance..

with-originate-metric.description: Use original metric of redistributed route.

redistribute-others.description: Redistribute information from another routing protocol.

redistribute-other.description: Redistribute information from another routing protocol.

in-or-out.description: Specify the direction of offset list.

acl-name.description: Access list of networks to apply offset list(1-31 characters).

for-ifs.description: Apply offset lists to RIP interface.

for-if.description: Apply offset lists to RIP interface.

in-or-out.description: Specify the direction of offset list.

acl-name.description: Access list of networks to apply offset (1-31 characters).

auth-keychains.description: Configure authentication keychain in RIP module.

auth-keychain.description: Configure authentication keychain in RIP module.

auth-key-clear.description: Set the authentication key in clear text.

key-clear.description: Set the authentication key in clear text.

auth-key-encrypted.description: Set the authentication key in encrypted text.

key-encrypted.description: Set the authentication key in encrypted text.

rip_schema.description: The querying information processing of RIP module.

neighbors.description: The querying information of RIP neighbors.

neighbor.description:
The list of RIP neighbor querying information.
For all RIP neighbors of public network, need select obj-type(1).
For the special RIP neighbor of public network, need select obj-type(1) and neighbor-addr.
For all RIP neighbors of one VPN, need select obj-type(2) and vrf-name.
For the special RIP neighbor of one VPN, need select obj-type(2), vrf-name and neighbor-addr.

obj-type.description: The type of network. The "global" means the public network, the "vpn" means private network.

interfaces.description: The querying information of RIP interfaces.

interface.description:
The list of RIP interface querying information.
For all RIP interfaces of public network, need select obj-type(1).
For all RIP interface of one VPN, need select obj-type(2), vrf-name.
For the special RIP interface, need select if-name.

obj-type.description: The type of network. The "global" means the public network, the "vpn" means private network.

if-ip-addr.description: The IP address on the interface.

if-ip-masklen.description: The prefix length on the interface.

recieve-version.description: The version of RIP message which can be recieved on the interface.

send-version.description: The version of RIP message sent on the interface,include the send mode in RIP-2.

subnet-only.description: Only send subnet information about the interface.

notify-default-route.description: Notify default route on the interface.

originate-default-route.description: Originate default route on the interface.

neighbor-strict.description: The interface restrict mode of communicate with neighbors.

if-mode.description: The mode of the interface,include active(only send),passive(only recieve) and normal.

auth-mode.description: The authentication mode of the interface.

statistics.description: The querying information of RIP statistics.

statistic.description:
The list of RIP statistic querying information.
For RIP statistic of public instance, need select obj-type(1).
For RIP statistic of VRF instance, need select obj-type(2) and vrf-name.

obj-type.description: The type of network. The "global" means the public network, the "vpn" means private network.

request-packets-sent.description: The total of request packets sent.

response-packets-sent.description: The total of response packets sent.

request-packets-recieved.description: The total of request packets recieved.

response-packets-recieved.description: The total of response packets recieved.

routes.description: The querying information of RIP routes.

route.description:
The list of RIP route querying information.
For all RIP routes of public network, need select obj-type(1).
For the special RIP route of public network, need select obj-type(1), route-addr and route-mask-len.
For all RIP routes of one VPN, need select obj-type(2) and vrf-name.
For the special RIP route of one VPN, need select obj-type(2), vrf-name, route-addr and route-mask-len.

obj-type.description: The type of network. The "global" means the public network, the "vpn" means private network.

dest-addr.description: The destination IP address of route.

route.x-key: obj-type vrf-name dest-addr dest-mask-len serial-number nexthop-addr

route-statistics.description: The querying information of RIP route statistics.

route-statistic.description:
The list of RIP route statistic querying information.
For RIP route statistic of public instance, need select obj-type(1).
For RIP route statistic of VRF instance, need select obj-type(2) and vrf-name.

obj-type.description: The type of network. The "global" means the public network, the "vpn" means private network.

rip-discard.description: The statistic of RIP discard route.

rip-connected.description: The statistic of RIP connected route.
